name: Healthyfied Wagyupsal
description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb, high-fiber, and high-sodium culinary masterpiece with our Healthyfied Wagyupsal recipe. Perfect for health-conscious individuals looking to enjoy luxurious flavors without guilt, this dish combines Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef with a vibrant mix of fresh vegetables and kimchi. Each bite promises a burst of rich flavor and a multitude of health benefits, making it a standout addition to any healthy recipe collection.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, tomatoes, and lettuce under cold water. Pat them dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, and tomatoes into bite-sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the fresh thyme and rosemary.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mix the sliced vegetables, minced garlic, chopped thyme, chopped rosemary, and salt. Let it marinate for about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef into thin slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the marinated vegetables for about 5 minutes until they're slightly charred and tender, then remove and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, grill the Wagyu beef slices for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the grilled Wagyu beef alongside the grilled vegetables, fresh lettuce, and kimchi. Enjoy your Healthyfied Wagyupsal.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
